item.title: GitLab SonarQube Integration with dotNET
item.description: If you want to use SonarQube to scan your code during GitLab's CI/CD flow, please check the following procedures. GitLab + SonarQube (docker) GitLab + SonarQube (non-docker) If you choose non-docer, I think you are still in .NET 4.8 or below. You can reference http://dennys.github.io/en/doc/devops/gitlab-dotnet4-ci-cd/ to build .NET 4 applications in GitLab CI/CD flow. And you can following the following procedures to integrate SonarQube. Reference this document to integrate GitLab and SonarQube.

item.title: Use GitLab to do .NET 4.8 CI/CD
item.description: Remind This is for .NET 4.8 or below only!! Precondition You already have a GitLab (GitLab Saas or GitLab self managed). item.title: GitLab Checkmarx CI/CD Integration
item.description: Purpose Checkmarx is a good tool to do code analysis, but there are 2 pain points during the flow. Checkmarx can integrate SCM like GitHub/GitLab/..., but it cannot be triggered by by a code commit, it can only schedule the job to run the scan. (If I don't commit code, I don't want to waste resource to scan the code.) Checkmarx has a build-in issue tracking system, but I think most people prefer to use their issue tracking system in their Git or JIRA or .

item.title: GitLab Checkmarx SonarQube Integration
item.description: Purpose In previous article, we know how to integrate GitLab and Checkmarx. In this article, we want to integrate SonarQube too. When we commit code to GitLab, we want GitLab to trigger these actions automatically: GitLab sends the code to Checkmarx to scan. GitLab triggers SonarQube to sacn. SonarQube integrate Checkmarx's report. Procedure You can reference the official document: https://checkmarx.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SD/pages/169246832/SonarQube+Plugin+v8.5.0+and+up Download the plugin from here, it only supports SonarQube LTS version (for now, it's 8.
